page.title: 05Rubbery Farm
page.content: In this dairy farming area,recent Common Market agricultural policy which introduced milk quotas, has badly affected local farmers. The amount of milk that can be sold by each farm is limited to the equivalent of their 1983 production minus 10%. At 200 acre Rubbery (Rowberrow) Farm, Mr Vearncombe has reduced his herd of 100 cows to 90,milking 79 of them.He says"Thinking of ways of maintaining ones income on a reduced output,stimulates the mind". His answer to the problem is to buy in less feed and produce more on the farm.Increased corn production is milled for feed by a mobile mixing lorry which calls once a month. Farmhouse holidays and a new camping site for visitors now help the farm budget.
